alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Pamlico; Tyrrell; Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Washington, Hyde, Dare, southeastern Beaufort, Tyrrell and northeastern Pamlico Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 425 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near East Lake to near Ponzer to South Creek. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sladesville, Killkenny, Ponzer, Swindell Fork, Scranton, Gull Rock, Alligator, Gum Neck, Kilkenny, Fairfield, Mashoes, New Holland, Pamlico Beach, Lowland, Columbia, East Lake, Nebraska, Royal, Rose Bay and Leechville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Beaufort; Mainland Dare; Mainland Hyde; Pamlico; Tyrrell; Washington
